antichess
Class MachinePlayer

java.lang.Object
  antichess.MachinePlayer
All Implemented Interfaces:
net.antichess.ai.AiPlayer
public class MachinePlayer
extends Object
implements net.antichess.ai.AiPlayer

A MachinePlayer is a player of Antichess that uses artificial intelligence to decide on its moves.

Constructor Summary

Constructor Detail

MachinePlayer

public MachinePlayer(boolean isWhite,
                     int level)
Parameters:
isWhite -
level -
Effects:
Creates a new MachinePlayer with the normal starting board (as described in the assignment). If isWhite is true, the player plays as white, else as black. level is an optional, arbitrary integer which can be used to affect the algorithm the machine player uses. The tournament referee will always request a level 0 MachinePlayer.

MachinePlayer

public MachinePlayer(boolean isWhite,
                     int level,
                     String bd)
Parameters:
isWhite -
level -
bd -
Requires:
bd is a String containing a valid <pieces> element, including the start and end tag of <pieces>, as defined in the assignment.
Effects:
Creates a new MachinePlayer in the same way described by the constructor MachinePlayer(boolean, int), except that the initial board configuration is set to be the one described by the String bd.
Method Detail

getName

public String getName()
Returns:
a String representing the name of the MachinePlayer (this is needed for the tournament.)

makeMove

public String makeMove(String opponentMove,
                       long timeLeft,
                       long opponentTimeLeft)
Parameters:
opponentMove -
timeLeft -
opponentTimeLeft -
Returns:
a valid next move for this player in a String of the appropriate format, given the opponent's move, the time left for this player, and the time left for the opponent. (Both times are in milliseconds.) If opponentMove is the empty String, then the board for this player should be considered up to date (as would be the case if this player is asked to make the first move of the game). NOTE: This procedure may run greater than timeLeft, but this would mean losing the game.
Requires:
opponentMove be either a String representing a valid move by the opponent on the board stored in this (in the "standard string format" defined by the assignment), or the empty String. Also, timeLeft > 0 && opponentTimeLeft > 0.
Modifies:
this

getMove

public String getMove(String move,
                      long time,
                      long opponentTime)
The same as makeMove(String, long, long), to implement the AiPlayer interface
